articles.title: Covid-19 linked to higher risk of brain conditions up to two years on
articles.description: The risk of being diagnosed with a neurological or psychiatric condition up to two years after catching covid-19 may be higher than with other respiratory infections, such as seasonal influenza
articles.content:
By Jason Arunn Murugesu
In severe cases, covid-19 may cause certain neurological and psychiatric conditions for up to two years post-infection
STANCA SANDA / Alamy
People who have had covid-19 hav… [+5027 chars]

articles.title: More than one in eight Reddit users publish toxic posts
articles.description: An analysis of 1.2 million Reddit users found that around 16 per cent of people wrote toxic posts and 13 per cent wrote toxic comments, such as direct insults
articles.content:
By Chris Stokel-Walker
Reddit posts have been analysed for toxic content
Postmodern Studio/Shutterstock
More than one in eight Reddit users publish toxic content, according to an analysis of more … [+2448 chars]

articles.title: UK schools are teaching teenagers about mental health in the wrong way
articles.description: Rather than helping, lessons may be encouraging pupils to dwell on negative feelings without the necessary support to address them
articles.content:
By Lucy Foulkes
TEENAGERS are experiencing a mental health crisis. I am not just talking about the increase in mental health problems that have been reported in them over the past decade or so. I am… [+381 chars]

articles.title: Physicists surprised to discover the proton contains a charm quark
articles.description: The textbook description of a proton says it contains three smaller particles - two up quarks and a down quark - but a new analysis has found strong evidence that it also holds a charm quark
articles.content:
By Alex Wilkins
An artist’s impression of a proton – the large red spheres are up quarks and the large blue sphere a down quark
CERN
The proton, a particle found at the heart of every atom, appear… [+4019 chars]

articles.title: The star Betelgeuse has stopped dimming – but it's still acting weird
articles.description: After a weird event dubbed the Great Dimming in 2019, the plasma that makes up Betelgeuse is sloshing around inside the star, erasing pulsations that have been measured for centuries
articles.content:
By Leah Crane
Betelgeuse is up to its usual tricks again
Stocktrek Images, Inc./Alamy
Betelgeuse is still acting strange. As the star recovers from blasting out a huge amount of its innards in lat… [+383 chars]

articles.title: Video calls improved cognition in older people at risk of Alzheimer’s
articles.description: For socially isolated older people with mild cognitive impairment, 30-minute video calls four times a week improved cognition, happiness and brain connectivity
articles.content:
By Grace Wade
Regular video call conversations can help improve cognition
Shutterstock/StockImageFactory.com
Chatting with someone over video call for 30-minutes, 4 times a week improves cognition… [+447 chars]

articles.title: Chewing can increase your body's energy use by up to 15 per cent
articles.description: Researchers used a plastic dome placed over people's heads to measure how much energy they expended chewing gum versus sitting idly. They found chewing gum uses a significant amount of energy
articles.content:
By Jason Arunn Murugesu
Chewing gum can significantly increase the body’s energy use
Kondoros Eva Katalin/Getty Images
Chewing uses a surprising amount of energy. An experiment that looked at the … [+2425 chars]

articles.title: Ancient megalodon shark could eat a whale in just a few bites
articles.description: The first 3D reconstruction of a huge, ancient shark called megalodon suggests it was even bigger than previously thought
articles.content:
By Christa Lesté-Lasserre
Megalodon was large enough to eat whales with ease
J. J. Giraldo
Megalodon, an ancient shark, had such a huge appetite that it could have swallowed an 8-metre-long whale … [+370 chars]

articles.title: A second asteroid may have struck Earth when the dinosaurs died out
articles.description: A possible impact crater under the sea off West Africa might have been made by a smaller piece that broke off the asteroid that wiped out most dinosaurs
articles.content:
By Michael Le Page
Dinosaurs may have been hit by two or more impacts in a short period of time
serpeblu/Shutterstock
What appears to be a 9 kilometre-wide crater has been discovered buried beneat… [+3687 chars]

articles.title: More than half of people infected with omicron may not know it
articles.description: Out of 210 people who had antibodies suggesting they had recently had the covid-19 omicron variant, more than half were unaware they were carrying the virus
articles.content:
By Carissa Wong
More than half of people who are infected with omicron may be unaware they are carrying the virus
